description:
It all started in 1990, when the founding partners opened a hot dog cart on West 53rd & 6th Avenue, New York, NY. The saw a huge demand among the Muslim cab drivers needing to have a halal Muslim meal. They quickly exchanged their cart and began servicing halal food, which became a huge success. They focused on the enhancement of their products to make it different and enjoyable. From that time, they pledged to use the best halal products to serve the public. During that time, they created their special magic white sauce and fiery hot sauce, which our public loves.

The second opening is on the southeast corner of W.53rd Street and 6th Avenue across from the main cart that is next to the Hilton hotel. The third opening was on the southwest corner of 7th avenue and W53rd Street. The fourth opening was at the LaGuardia Community College in front of the Thomas. The fifth opening was on the northeast corner of East 14th Street and 2nd Avenue. Our latest opening, is our first brick and mortar shop, The Halal Guys Store, which is also located on East 14th Street and 2nd avenues. Now The Halal Guys has steadily grown to become the leading and largest food cart company within the New York area.

Now the quick-service halal street cart company is going national, creating a chain that keeps the core values and provides opportunities to new partners who want to share The Halal Guys experience. The Halal Guys Inc. is a federal registered company that has a registered trademark, name, logo and slogan and is a privately held and family owned.

With 24 consecutive years of positive sales growth, The Halal Guys has set itself apart by pioneering innovations and creating delicious products—including the ever-popular White Sauce for customers.
name: The Halal Guys

Menina's Mash: Vegetable pie with spinach, potatoes, onion and spices wrapped inside of our flakey phyllo.


SWEET PASTRIES:
Baklava: The traditional greek pastry of layered chopped almonds, walnuts -- wrapped in our golden brown phyllo drenched in honey. Rolled baklava for eating on-the-go!

Galaktoboureko: Our famous, rich custard pastry our wrapped in flakey phyllo.

Afalfi: A circular pastry filled with chopped pistachios surrounded by our phyllo and soaked in honey.

Kataif: Shredded dough surrounding crushed walnuts and almonds soaked in honey.

Trigona: An almond paste triangle surrounded by our golden brown phyllo and soaked in honey.


STRUDELS:
Apple: Apples and raisins with cinnamon rolled in our flakey phyllo.
Apricot: Apricots wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Apricot Cheese: Apricots and a mixture of slightly sweetened ricotta and cream cheese, wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Cherry: Three types of cherries wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Cherry Cheese: Three types of cherries anda mixture of slightly sweetened ricotta and cream cheese, wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Pineapple Cheese: Pineapple anda mixture of slightly sweetened ricotta and cream cheese, wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Poppy Seed: Poppy seed filling wrapped in our flakey phyllo.

Prune: Prunes wrapped in our flakey phyllo.


COOKIES:
Finikia: A crushed walnut and almond cookie, soaked in honey.

Kourambiethes: A rich butter almond cookie, buried in powdered sugar, it melts in your mouth!

Koulourakia: A light, crispy cookie with sesame seeds.
name: Poseidon Bakery

about: "The Ethiopian restaurant Queen of Sheba offers unique, exotic meals in a relaxed setting. Delicious vegetarian, chicken, lamb, beef, fish are available at bargain prices. A great New York find!" - Richard J. Scholem - Restaurant Critic
description:
Philipos Mengistu gained his first culinary experience at the restaurant his parents operated in Addis Abeba in the early 1970's. Philipos used to spend much of his time behind the scenes in the restaurant kitchen. He watched his mother intently over the years, learning recipes that had been passed from generation to generation through the family lineage, and picking up his mother's expertise. One area being in blending her own version of berbere, a hot sauce common in much of the Ethiopian cuisine.

Philipos moved to the United States in 1990, with the concept of introducing New York City to Ethiopian food. As he scouted locations and saved money for his first business in the US, he worked as an aircraft technician for Ethiopian Airways and a Yellow Cab driver.

Philipos opened his first restaurant, 'Meskerem Ethiopian Restaurant', with two partners in 1995. Meskerem was a success, receiving positive reviews from the New York Times and the Daily News, among others.

In 1999, Philipos launched plans to run his own restaurant, this time with the aim of focusing specifically on his family's recipes and creating a warm and cozy environment, surrounded by traditional Ethiopian decor. He spent a year scouting the ideal venue and perfecting the ingredients of his new menu, as well as arranging to import berbere directly from his own mother in Ethiopia, using only her recipe.
name: Queen of Sheba NYC

description:
Randolph's Bar & Lounge is the place to see and be seen. Named after William Randolph Hearst, Randolph’s has an atmosphere that radiates with the sophisticated and timeless allure of a past era. Designed to resemble all the comforts of a living room, this classic bar and lounge is the perfect place to take a break and relax from your daily activities, whether if you’re coming in from work or just touring around the vast city. Eat from our various lunch and dinner selections refined by the executive chef, and drink from our extensive wine list. It’s the perfect way to take a breather from the buzz of Midtown and watch the world pass by while sitting in front one of our large windows that overlook the Avenue of the Americas. 

We are open daily from 12:00 pm to 1:00 am, with last call at 12:30 am. Join us for drinks during our operating hours as stated, for lunch from 12:00 pm to 5:00 pm, and for dinner from 5:00 pm to 11:00 pm. 

Like our Facebook page for the latest news and offers and visit our website, www.murals54.com, for menus and for more information (under the Entertainment and Bar section).
name: Randolph's Bar and Lounge

description: At Bareburger, we take a simple, joyful and organic approach to food. We believe that fresh, vibrant, clean food served in a fun place can make the world smile. Ingredients should be sourced as close to home as possible, but if Wisconsin has the best cheese and Montana knows bison as well as Texas knows elk, we believe that above all else, partnerships should make sense. We take as much pride in preparing and cooking our food as we do sourcing it. The point is, we are not those “pre-cook” guys. We do not reheat. We cook fresh, we serve fresh. We do it right the first time, even if it takes a few extra minutes. Whether you are impeccably health-conscious, or strictly appreciative of great grub, we have something you’ll happily devour. We don’t serve the biggest burger. We don’t serve the smallest burger. We serve the most responsible burger. We may not have a dollar menu, but we do have the quality, flavor and love that every organic, delicious burger deserves.
name: Bareburger

about: Welcome to Mr. Broadway. Since 1922, we’ve served New York City, NY foods prepared from scratch using the only freshest ingredients we can find.
description:
We bring New York City some of its finest Jewish and Mediterranean dishes through our incredibly hard work and culinary expertise. Tame your appetite with the Falafel Trio, Stuffed Cabbage, or a fresh Turkish Salad. Enjoy a tasty glass of wine while you explore our diverse and appetizing menu. We offer authentic salads, sandwiches, burgers, and more from recipes refined over time. 

Throughout the years, we have always relied on homemade cooking with the freshest ingredients we can find. Our people are working in the very early hours of the morning preparing everything from scratch – from our famous Shawarma, to the daily variety of soups, fresh ground in-house beef burgers and all other scrumptious creations!

For over 50 years we have delighted in satisfying the distinct appetite of our customers and we wish all the best who walk through our doors and consider it a ‘Mitzva’ to serve you and your family! You are graciously invited to the famous Mr. Broadway!
name: Mr. Broadway

description:

The cozy setting gets even more intimate on crowded game nights, when fans down beer specials and order from our extensive menu, featuring gourmet sandwiches, salads, wings and more. Rowdy with standing room only on the weekend and game nights, neither crowds nor loud sports bar kitsch will drown out your conversation here on calmer weeknights.

description:
Jennifer Appel began her professional career as a clinical psychologist, but the culinary arts were in her blood – she remembers her mother and grandmothers creating a variety of masterpieces in the family’s kitchen. Jennifer enjoyed cooking and baking to relax after a long day.   Before long, her hobby became a passion.

In July 1996, she threw herself into the bakery business full-time, opening Magnolia Bakery in New York City’s Greenwich Village.  In August 1999, Jennifer ventured out on her own to open Buttercup Bake Shop.  Since its opening, the shop has experienced outstanding success with its old-fashioned American desserts and the inviting ambiance.

Buttercup’s classic American desserts continue to be enjoyed by New Yorkers of all kinds, including Martha Stewart, Al Roker, and Senator Hillary Clinton, amongst others.  Buttercup has appeared on The Today Show several times, and featured on MTV,  Fox,  CNN and more, as well as in the romantic novel  “A Match Made on Madison” by Dee Davis.
name: Buttercup Bake Shop

about: Mad Dog & Beans 38 Located @38th street & 5th Ave Is the sister location to our Mad Dog & Beans Mexican Cantina located on historic Stone Street in FIDI. Celebrating 10 years of serving our famous guacamole & killer Margaritas with our new opening.
description:
Mad Dog & Beans Mexican Cantina is a casual-upscale Mexican restaurant featuring a traditional Mexican menu. The theme is based on the Mexican Revolution. The decor features vintage black-and-white photos of banditos and scenes of Mexico printed on canvas and displayed throughout the restaurant. 

Barn wood, iron, weathered furniture, wrought-iron chandeliers, Edison bulbs, candlelight and other traditional decorative elements all combine to provide a warm and rustic dining atmosphere.

Flat-screen televisions in the bar area feature sports and vintage Mexican movies, while stainless-steel and glass Guacamole stations add a modern contrast to the overall look. 

Music is a lively Mexican and Spanish selection during the day at both the bar area and the dining area. During happy hour, the bar area switches over to top 100, classic and contemporary rock, while guests can enjoy a more traditional Mexican dining experience in our back dining room where Mexican/Spanish music continues to play.
name: Mad Dog & Beans Mexican Cantina - 38th St.

Near Penn Station, this new American restaurant and sports bar also boasts a popular happy hour in Midtown NYC serving craft beer, fresh cocktails and mixed drinks.

Named for Rowland H. Macy, the storied founder of Macy’s, Rowland’s Bar & Grill builds upon his magnanimous character with intriguing bits of his life, quotes and favorite foods, like the signature cheddar-stuffed RH Burger. Rowland’s is the perfect gathering place for lunch and dinner when shopping New York’s most famous store.

Not only do we serve authentic Italian dishes, but we also offer classic steakhouse fare. Both restaurants have been a broadway "go-to" for years so the idea to combine them seemed like a "no brainer!" The choice of both dining styles is an appeal both to theater goers, NYC visitors, and locals.

about: In the very heart of midtown, we craft,  using only the best ingredients, our food and drink offerings to provide you with the most authentic experience.
description:
Within 2 blocks of Herald Square and Macy’s, Habanero Blues enjoys easy access to NYC’s Penn Station, Port Authority Bus Terminal and Grand Central Station.   The MTA’s  B, D, F, R & 1,2, 3 trains have an entrance on the next corner.

Cuisine:

Habanero Blues uses only the finest ingredients. Our culinary team has traveled throughout Mexico for the most authentic recipes, and the combined result is the freshest and tastiest homemade Mexican food in New York.

Cocktails
Only top quality tequila, 100% agave nectar and freshly squeezed lime juice are used in making our signature margarita. Habanero Blues mixology team have developed seasonal cocktails to please any palate, and we feature a range of Mexican beer as well as a choice of fine wines.

With seating for over 600 guests Habanero Blues features private dining areas for your company’s party or special occasion.  Go to http://habaneroblues.com for more information on planning your next event. Our event coordinator will work with you to tailor an event which will meet any budget.

Here at Habanero Blues, we have a simple philosophy:  Our guests’ satisfaction is our number one priority, and nothing less will be tolerated. We do our level best to train and retain only positive, hospitality oriented individuals, and we work as a team to ensure your complete satisfaction every time you visit.

Second to none, Habanero Blues’ design  is stunning to the eye, each of its 3 floors featuring its very full-service  bar, and each floor with its own distinctive, yet cohesive personality.

about: Badshah will feature inventive dishes inspired by Indian street food, and signature classics updated in creative ways.
description: At Badshah Modern Indian, an innovative Indian restaurant in NYC, we prepare and serve a mix of traditional Indian cuisine and inventive dishes inspired by Indian street food. Our head chef brings years of experience to our kitchen and combines traditional cooking methods with novel ingredients from across Asia to create exciting meals just for you, our wonderful guests. With authentic ingredients, beautiful presentation, and creative pairings, we transport guests to the very streets of India. An alluring destination for lunch or dinner, Bricco offers creative Italian fare in an inviting multi-level atmosphere. The dining area includes a large bar, relaxed dining room, wood fired pizza over and two private rooms on the second floor, making each dining experience one to remember. about: Utsav, a word with origins in Sanskirt, means festival. Join us in the joy of our food and culture.
description:

It is adjoining the Laura Pels Theatre and is also located within walking distance from numerous other Broadway shows including the very popular An American In Paris. There is a cozy lounge on the lower level with outdoor dining available in summer. The upper level newly renovated dining room has floor to ceiling glass windows overlooking both 46th & 47th streets. 

In addition to the a la carte menu Utsav offers a daily lunch buffet and a three course prix fixe menu at dinner.
 
Chef Hari Nayak, the author of five cookbooks is known as one of the pioneers of modern Indian cuisine. At Utsav, he introduces some of his dishes that fuse the flavors of India with his signature modern New York twist. His goal is to change the way you perceive and experience Indian cuisine. The wine list at Utsav is made by James Beard award winning Consulting Sommelier Rajat Parr.

about: Daniela's offers traditional Italian cuisine in the heart of New York's theatre district. We have a full menu available for breakfast, lunch and dinner. http://www.danielarestaurant.com
description:
Named one of New York’s best Italian restaurants by the New York Insider, Daniela’s Trattoria offers traditional Italian cuisine in the heart of New York’s theatre district. Unlike many Italian restaurants, we are open early for breakfast. Our breakfast menu includes items such as pancakes, omelets, eggs benedict, breakfast sandwiches and coffee. For lunch and dinner, pick from a wide range of options like our Caprese salad, Minestrone soup, Eggplant Parmigiana sandwich, or one of our delicious pizzas, pastas or entrees. We have several dessert options including tiramisu, cheesecake and chocolate lava cake, and a large selection of wine and beer.
 
Our location is convenient to the theatre district, Times Square and Midtown West, so stop in for dinner before you head to a show. If you live in the area and want to eat your meal at home, we offer a takeout option and free delivery within 15 blocks of the restaurant. We also host special events in the restaurant such as banquets, private parties and corporate events, and can provide off-site catering.

description: Lindy's is a deli and restaurant with two locations in Manhattan, New York City, at 825 7th Avenue (at 53rd Street) and 401 7th Avenue (at 32nd Street). Lindy's is best known for its original incarnation which opened in 1921 on Broadway. It is currently owned by the Riese Organization.HistoryLindy's was opened by Leo "Lindy" Lindermann and his wife Clara on August 20, 1921, and was located at 1626 Broadway, between 49th and 50th Streets. A second location was opened at 1655 Broadway in 1929. The original Lindy's location closed in 1957. In 1969, the 1655 Broadway location was acquired by Longchamps restaurants, who closed the restaurant in September 1969 to convert it into a steak house .Damon Runyon was a big fan and wrote the restaurant into his books as "Mindy's." The musical Guys and Dolls, based on Runyon's writings, immortalizes Lindy's in one of its songs.Milton Berle frequented Lindy's almost on a nightly basis.Jewish Mafia icon Arnold Rothstein claimed Lindy's as his favorite "office" and would stand on the corner, surrounded by bodyguards, and conduct business outside.On April 5, 1956, Abraham Telvi, a mobster and hit man, attacked journalist Victor Riesel with acid, blinding him as he left the restaurant.
name: Lindy's

Located just minutes from Times Square and the Theatre District in the heart of Hell's Kitchen, we're the perfect dinner destination for locals and visitors alike.

We source the finest whiskeys, gins, and vodkas to bring you fresh, innovative options with a nod to the past. Our Prohibition-era decor offers the perfect atmosphere to keep the spirits and the conversation flowing. about: Eritrean-Ethiopian street food, gracing the streets of New York one bite at a time.  Come check us out for lunch around midtown east.
description:
Are you looking for something unique to try for lunch? Take your taste buds on a trip across the globe with a mixture of flavorful delicacies from Ethiopia. As New York’s first Ethiopian cuisine food truck, Makina Café offers a vibrant mix of Ethiopian, Eritrean, and Italian delicacies. These healthy and delicious menu items are paired with exceptional service that will have you stopping back time after time.

   

  There’s something for everyone to enjoy from this unique food truck, and their tasty selections won’t result in a hit to your calorie intake for the day. Meat lovers can indulge in chicken and beef tibs that are seasoned to perfection, while those living a strictly vegan lifestyle can take advantage of vegan food dishes like split pea stew, string beans with carrots, and collard greens.

   

  You and your friends can pair your base of flatbread, yellow rice, or sandwich bread with meats or veggies, followed by your choice of three homemade sauces, including lemon and olive oil, awaze, and the signature Makina sauce. If you’re in the mood for a smaller meal, snack on a sambusa, a tasty treat that comes fried or baked with a savory lentil or beef filling.

   

  Locally owned and operated, this food truck guarantees authentic food and fresh ingredients. Passionate staff members are dedicated to bringing Ethiopian and Eritrean cooking to you at affordable prices. 

   

  When searching for a different meal for your lunch, check out the exquisite menu options at Makina Café. Call them today at (917) 426-5649 or visit them online for more information.
name: Makina Cafe

about: Daelmans Stroopwafels are the best gourmet treat you can find in the world! We are the marketleader and you can find our stroopwafels in 30 countries.
description:
Daelmans stroopwafels have earned a global reputation as the perfect complement to coffee, tea or your favorite hot beverage, owing to a particularly unique consumption ritual…stroopwafels can be warmed and softened when placed on top of your beverage! Rest a stroopwafel atop a cup of freshly poured, steaming hot coffee for about 2 minutes, and the heat from your coffee will warm the biscuit, soften the caramel and release the aroma of natural cinnamon and vanilla, transforming your waffle into a warm, sweet, melty treat!

They are now available all over the US!
name: Daelmansstroopwafels_US

A casual and family-friendly restaurant, Cafe 2 features communal seating and an Espresso Bar for Museum visitors who want to take a quick break to recharge after an enriching day in the galleries. 10 seasonal Italian wine selections are available by the quartino or bottle. 

Terrace 5 is a full service café offering a seasonal menu of delicious à la carte savory selections complemented by an array of mouthwatering desserts. Wines are available by the glass or bottle, alongside a selection of distinctive seasonal cocktails and micro-brewed beers. This sophisticated, airy café is situated adjacent to the Painting and Sculpture Galleries, and enjoys a spectacular fifth-floor view of The Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Sculpture Garden and the surrounding skyline, with outdoor terrace dining available seasonally.

about: Just a girl who wanted to make her husband happy| check our story on our website | All our macarons are 100% Gluten free
description:
"My dream has always been to own a little pastry shop."
The smell of croissants fresh out of the oven in the morning, coffee and hot chocolate while it's cold outside, few small tables by the window, couples having sweet treats and neighbors making their last stop before going home to pick up some fresh bread for dinner. It was just my imagination running wild back home.
A few years ago, I left my corporate job, moved to New York and married a Frenchman. Yes, you read well! A Frenchman, who would have thought! Sometimes it seemed to me that my husband missed Paris, so I began to bake some French cookies and pastries to remind him about his home sweet home. To my biggest surprise it was simply delicious, I decided to go learn and perfect my recipes during a vacation trip in Paris for a month.
What started as a hobby became a passion. In Paris i have discovered the art of making the perfect macaron. The process is certainly easy like all French recipes, but like all simple things in life, it can be very easy to make it a flop. Today I’m happy to say that I live my passion. What was all a dream became a reality. Baking for living is what I do now and I have never been so happy. 
We bake all our macrons with love!
name: Made by Pauline

about: Green Symphony offers fast, fresh meal options right in the heart of Times Square in NYC. Stop by for a cold pressed juice or fresh sandwich today!
description:
Green Symphony serves fresh, healthy food and drinks in New York City. Visit us in Times Square and walk away feeling good about your food choices!

At Green Symphony, we provide an oasis for vegetarians and anyone who wants to eat healthy in a quick and friendly atmosphere. Located just steps away from Times Square, we provide a variety of food choices for people of all food persuasions. Vegetarians, vegans, meat eaters alike can all find superb options at our smoothie bar, juice bar, salad bar, and sandwich station!

We feature hot and cold buffets for you to mix and match the food items you want. We also have a wide selection of menu items that we have designed just for you! Try one of our sensible salads, creative wraps, vegetable rice bowls, soups, or homemade desserts. We are especially proud of our mandoo bowls, made with Korean-style homemade dumplings with sesame-ginger tamari sauce.

We understand that in the hustle and bustle of city life, it can be hard to make quick, healthy food decisions. We are here to provide you with the best healthy food options at the pace that you expect for your busy lifestyle.

Stop by or order delivery and enjoy a cold-pressed juice, veggie rice bowl, or sandwich today!
name: Green Symphony

about: Purektchn is a health food restaurant with an emphasis on take out and delivery, including breakfast, lunch, and dinner service.
description:
Working in the restaurant business from the age of 15, Hunor Sandor had experience and knowledge about running a successful restaurant from his family members who owned a few but also from what he learned over the years.
Hunor Sandor wanted to open a vegan restaurant like no other, and after taking an extreme interest in the field of nutrition, Pure Ktchn was created. 
It is a vegan restaurant like no other. While many restaurants claim their food is organic and healthy, Pure Ktchn does not only use local and organic ingredients, but does not use any soy and frying is totally out of the question. Organic ingredients, along with super foods like coconut crème, goji berries, matcha and hemp seeds make the dishes they serve full of flavor and not just boring, bland vegan food. 
The atmosphere is cozy, welcoming and lots of plants and flowers are displayed.

about: Azuri Cafes serves a delicious fusion of Middle Eastern and Kosher cuisine, prepared healthily without sacrificing mouthwatering taste.
description:
Visit the land of Israel through the tastes and textures of Azuri Cafe. 

Our original recipes draw inspiration from authentic cuisines of the Middle East while simultaneously offering a fresh, new take on combining spices and ingredients not offered in the Middle East.

Middle Eastern food has become very popular in the United States because of its large selection of healthy dishes. At Azuri Cafe, we use olive oil, chickpeas, and lentils in our traditional dishes. We even use flax seeds, ginger, soy, and oats to make our dishes even healthier.

Come to us for the best falafel and shawarma in town. Our falafel is made from the freshest chickpeas, onions, parsley, and our own special blend of herbs and spices. Because of our special mixture, our falafels come out light and fluffy without the heavy texture and greasy taste of other falafel vendors. 

Come visit Azuri and taste what it truly means to cook from the heart.

about: At China Xiang, we only use the finest and freshest ingredients in our dishes.
description:
Looking for a great Chinese Restaurant? Well, one is now in Hell's Kitchen at 42nd & 9th there is a new jewel. This authentic Hunan cuisine is prepared much different than other styles. The sauces are made from scratch eliminating MSG. The casseroles and BBQ meats which we are famous for, are not what you think, they are smoked giving them a great flavor and of course lots of hot peppers. If you like hot pepper this is the place for you. Don't worry there are other dishes to choose from. 

Try the sticky rice steamed (20 mins.) with pork ribs topped with Japanese bonita chips, not only a great presentation but delicious. Fresh fish head with chilis (20 mins.) Pork with miso and scallions or lamb with cumin will keep you coming back. Vegans don't despair, loofah with garlic (20 mins.) not to be missed and not found in many places. Snowpea leaf in season, wood ear mushroom w/ yam and okra with garlic just to mention a few.

This is a place for Foodies, the wines are special selected choices of French, Chile and California, pairing well with the cuisine. On the Dim Sum menu, worth the wait for steamed pork dumplings (20 mins.) and don't overlook the Dandan noodles. For variety the Hunan soup menu is a good choice. The concept of “no tipping” gives tourists a relief. The majority of clientele are Chinese, a great advertisement in itself. “A” rating in a lovely decorated place make reservations a must!
name: China Xiang

about: Desi Grub serves up delicious and fresh Indian kati rolls to hungry New Yorkers looking for a fast lunch or dinner option while still eating mindfully.
description:
Kati rolls are street-food originating from Kolkata, India. Today, pretty much any filling rolled up in any kind of Indian flatbread is called a kati roll. Kati Junction’s menu covers a wide range of inventive rolls, including offering vegetarian options, chicken, beef and lamb. We marinate all of our meats overnight before we grill them to impart bold flavors into each dish. All of our ingredients are fresh and of the highest quality. And if you don’t want your meal rolled in flatbread, we also serve each dish in bowls too.

We can deliver within a one mile radius and also offer great catering options for all size of crowds.
name: Desi Grub

about: A New York City institution since 1926, Frankie & Johnnie’s Steakhouse started out as a whiskey joint and carnivorous speakeasy during Prohibition.
description:
A New York City institution since 1926, Frankie & Johnnie’s Steakhouse started out as a whiskey joint and carnivorous speakeasy during Prohibition. True to the unlawful ways of that era, to enter the speakeasy the watchword was “Frankie;” the password was “Johnnie.” And so it began…

Cut to 1985. A long-time waiter at Frankie & Johnnie’s, Peter Chimos, purchases the landmark restaurant with his brother-in-law.  They carry on the tradition, staying true to its original concept and the history that is not only embedded into its walls, but to the legacy that’s told through the photos and Broadway show posters that adorn every level of the momentous space. Perfectly Char-grilled steaks, hearty potato sides and creamed spinach are mainstays on the menu. Over the years the menu has evolved with added raw bar items, fish dishes and more side dishes to further appeal to the Broadway crowd and tourists. 

The 90th anniversary of Frankie & Johnnie’s Steakhouse marked the end of the 45th Street location and the opening of its new location up the road at 320 West 46th Street, a much larger space featuring 2 levels and  a 140-seat restaurant with a private dining room (25 pl) and an expansive bar. The revitalized space will now house the numerous vintage posters and snapshots of an era gone by and the people, celebrities and politicos who frequented Frankie & Johnnie’s Steakhouse and helped shape what a true New York City steakhouse embodies.
name: Frankie & Johnnie's Steakhouse

description:
Come to Villa Italian Kitchen at 625 8th Avenue, New York, NY for a delicious Italian meal. 
 
Villa Italian Kitchen was founded with one store, one family and one concept in 1964, when our founder, Michele “Michael” Scotto brought his authentic old-world recipes from Naples, Italy to New York City. Michele’s commitment to hospitality, quality ingredients, like homemade dough, 100% whole milk mozzarella and fresh sauce and the strict loyalty to those now famous recipes, built the business. From that first Villa Pizza that opened in 1964, next to the CBS/Ed Sullivan Theater on Broadway, to nearly 300 Villa Italian Kitchen restaurants later, our commitment to quality and genuine hospitality remains the basis of our foundation.
In 2014, Villa Italian Kitchen and its parent company Villa Restaurant Group celebrated its 50th Anniversary. Today, Villa is under the leadership of Michele’s two sons Biagio “Ben” Scotto and Anthony Scotto. Together, they continue the vision and passion of their father extending the genuine hospitality inspired by their father.
name: Villa Fresh Italian Kitchen

about: You haven’t tasted pizza until you’ve tried Prova Pizzabar! An authentic Italian pizza bar located in the Lower Level Dining Concourse at Grand Central NY.
description:
Just when you thought you’d tasted it all, Prova Pizzabar has changed everything. While our next-generation pizza is inspired by Neapolitan tradition, it shatters the paradigms of Neapolitan, New York, and every other existing style. Using the highest water content, longest proofing process and most authentic Italian ingredients, ours is the lightest, most digestible and purely-delicious pizza you’ll ever eat.

Served in seconds when you’re on the go — or with a cocktail in a setting as transcendent as the taste – Prova Pizzabar is an original.
name: Prova Pizzabar

about: 2 Dough Boyz is an Edible Cookie Dough Company rooted in NYC specializing in original flavors with a truly New York style.  #2DB
description:
Cookie dough: It's delicious. What else do you need to know?

So now that we have that covered, we need to sort through the mess of dessert concepts.  We need an attitude.  We need a personality.  We need something that New Yorkers young and old love...90s hip-hop.   

Combine this New York nostalgic attitude with a delicious childhood treat and we get a dessert that's going to bring us back to those hot, carefree summer days of '95 with Clinton in the White House and Biggie on the Summer Jam stage.

Served with or without a scoop of vanilla ice cream, 2 Dough Boyz brings an inventive twist to the raw, eggless cookie dough genre.  We offer two base doughs (classic chocolate chip and sugar), four inventive menu options (named after 90s hip-hop albums or songs) and a wide range of customizations available.  

We keep it simple.  We keep it tasty.  We keep it real.
name: 2 Dough Boyz

about: Kuro-Obi offers Ippudo NY style and quality for those who don’t have the time to dine and experience Ippudo NY’s real japanese style and quality ramen!
description:
The renown ramen experts of Ippudo NY will open their next ramen concept at the City Kitchen in the ROW NYC Hotel, in February 2015. Kuro-Obi elevates the precise craft of ramen making, by offering true Japanese ramen cultural style of (The quick five minute ramen meal”. Ippudo NY will break the traditional ramen rule of “No take home” or “Take out”, that they are so infamously known for. Thus, Kuro-Obi will be the first and only Ippudo NY brand to allow and offer “ramen on the Go”.   

Kuro-Obi offers Ippudo NY style and quality for those who don’t have the time to dine and experience Ippudo NY’s real japanese style and quality ramen. To further differentiate, The Ramen Master has created a new ramen recipe that is more friendly to the perils of “take away ramen” for Kuro-Obi, and will focus on exclusively offering “tori paitan”, a delicate silky pork and chicken blended soup base. 

The goal is to allow many more visitors and New Yorker’s to have a chance to experience and savor Ippudo NY’s ramen. “Real Japanese style, and SWIFT”, is Kuro-Obi Ramen Dojo. The proof shall be in the bowls! Slurps up!
name: Kuro-Obi Ramen NYC

about: With five locations in Manhattan and one in London, England, The Kati Roll Company served authentic street Kati Rolls just like the ones in Kolkata, India.
description:
What started out as one woman’s nostalgia for her favorite hometown eats soon turned into one of New York’s most popular eateries. The Kati Roll Company started in 2000  in New York’s Greenwich Village and now has five locations in Manhattan, as well as one across the pond in London, England. 

TKRC is the brainchild of female entrepreneur, Payal Saha, originally from Kolkata, India. She started the business with a very simple concept, “I tremendously missed Kati Rolls, and there weren’t any in New York when I first moved here,” she remembers, “I just wanted to have a place where I could enjoy Kolkata’s street foods. I thought if I missed it so much, other people must too.”

With its warm paratha’s (or alternate whole wheat roti) wrapped around various spice laden fillings, the aromatic rolls have turned many hungry folks into bonafide TKRC devotees, some traveling across state lines to satisfy their kati roll fix. 

Veg or non-veg, South Asian or not, the one thing that TKRC fans have in common is their desire for fresh and easy food, so much so that they are willing to wait in sometimes long lines for the soul-satisfying fare. But don’t take our word for it, Google The Kati Roll Company and see for yourselves. Or better yet, stop in and get your kati roll on. Trust us, you’ll be back.
name: The Kati Roll Company

description: The Russian Tea Room is a Russo-Continental restaurant, located at 150 West 57th Street (between Sixth Avenue and Seventh Avenue), between Carnegie Hall Tower and Metropolitan Tower, in the Manhattan borough of New York City.HistoryThe Russian Tea Room was opened in 1927, by former members of the Russian Imperial Ballet, as a gathering place for Russian expatriates, and became famous as a gathering place for those in the entertainment industry. The founder is often considered to be Polish-born Jacob Zysman, but in that year, a corporation directory gives Albertina Rasch as the president and her name appears along with Russian Art Chocolate and Russian Tea Room, in early photographs of the shopfront at 145 W. 57th St. In 1929, the business moved across the street to its present location, which at that time was an Italianate brownstone, built in 1875 by German immigrant John F. Pupke, a tea and coffee merchant, whose son later moved the large clan to Long Island, seeking a more relaxed lifestyle.By 1933, the Siberian émigré Alexander Maeef was running the Russian Tea Room and was the main personality associated with the restaurant for the next fifteen years.
name: Russian Tea Room

about: Our homepage for all culinary news for the Tour de France Restaurant Group
description:
Come Visit Us at Our NYC Locations

www.tourdefrancenyc.com

Making a gastronomic tour of France does not necessarily have to involve an airplane and calculating the exchange rate- the Tour de France Restaurant Group brings the varied and celebrated cuisines of France to Manhattan, without ever requiring a trip over the Triborough Bridge. The eight restaurants each transport diners to a different region, inviting them to experience the atmosphere and flavors of France right here in New York CIty. 


Two French Roast locations and L'Express please legions of diners 24 hours a day, Maison allows people to bask in the sun smack in the middle of midtown Manhattan, Le Monde opens a world of possibilities to uptown diners, Marseille and Nice Matin put a creative spin on the foods of those regions due to the talent of Chef Andy D'Amico and Pigalle is probably the truest brasserie in town. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner takes you from one end of France to the other, destinations that have long held our fascination for their beauty and culinary achievements.


To experience the coastal flavors of Brittany, travel to Maison. Continue the journey at Le Monde, a celebration of the cuisine of the Loire Valley. Heat things up with a stop at Pigalle, named for Montmartre's red light district. Head downtown to L'Express, where this Lyonnaise bouchon merges the traditional southern and northern influences of French cooking. Take a relaxing turn with a trip to Southern France's Cote d'Azur at Nice Matin.
Then travel to Marseille, a Provençal city with vitality, centered around a 26-century-old port. 

Move on to Café d'Alsace where world famous Chef Philippe Roussel prepares his fathers native Alsatian cuisine with specialities such as Choucroute Garnie, Trout Almondine, Pike Quenelles, Foie Gras, Duck Ballontine or his famous Baeckoffe. Chef Philippe Roussel also offers bistro standards such as a black hanger Steak Frites, Moules and Frites and Quiche Lorraine.
The sommelier at Cafe D'Alsace is sure to pair your meal with either a beer from their incredible list featuring over 100 choices or with a fine wine from the multiple award winning wine list with numerous Alsatian great wines like Pinot Gris, Muscat, Riesling, Gerwurztraminer or Pinot Blanc.

Then to finish in Paris , to French Roast, for the Parisian café society's dishes of choice: Croque Monsieur, Steak Frites, Escargot and Onion Soup. Twenty four hours a day, seven days a week, one can feel very Parisian at French Roast.
name: Tour de France-nyc

description:
It all started back in 1988 at a farmer's market in Downingtown, Pa., where Anne Beiler and her husband, Jonas, sold a variety of snacks, including hand-rolled, soft pretzels. Anne and Jonas tried different combinations of ingredients to make their pretzels until they found the one recipe that was better than the best, and the pretzel was perfected. 
Auntie Anne's now has more than 1,200 locations in 44 states and 23 countries. Our pretzel line-up includes Original, Cinnamon Sugar, Almond, Garlic, Sour Cream & Onion, and Pepperoni. Pretzel Stix and Nuggets are a portable option for pretzel lovers on the go. We also serve fresh, hot Pretzel Dogs, Auntie Anne’s signature lemonade, and dips to compliment your favorite pretzel flavor.
Every year, we roll more than 97 million pretzels; that’s Pretzel Perfect!
name: Auntie Anne's Pretzels of Times Square

description:
Our Hamburger Story

A man had a dream…
He wanted to create the most delicious hamburger and offer it at the best affordable price.

He studied day and night to obtain the best beef patty ever, starting from the selection of high quality beef, its meat parts and the mix ratio.
Within 3 years, he has eaten 3,000 patties, matching different meat parts and changing their ratios, going over hundreds of different recipes. 

One day, he mixed meat parts from US grown Kobe beef with free range Black Angus beef.
“This is IT!!” He shouted with joy.

The best beef patty combination was born! Black Angus Beef’s meatiness met the fine quality marbles of Kobe Beef, benefitting from Omega 3 fatty acids at the same time.

After trying day after day to combine different parts of Kobe Beef, the man finally came up with a mouthwatering recipe.
Smell the sweet aroma of the freshly grilled Kobe beef. It’s packed with umami.
Feel the rich flavors coming out of the Black Angus, bite after bite.
Savor the juiciness skillfully locked inside this unforeseen meat combination.

Please enjoy the blissful beef patty from a man’s dream that he constructed for years and finally became reality.

The Founder
name: USQBurger

description:
The Cookie Cutters is the brain child of fellow sisters Sara and Rivka L.

Wilton certified and veteran cake decorators, the two set out to make a perfect union between fondant and royal icing. Their winning debut was created as a gift for a best friend's engagement party but as they say the rest is history...

The team has taught cake decorating at a variety of venues ranging from charity fundraisers and bridal showers to schools and camps. Students have represented all ages and abilities including teens, cancer patients and children with developmental disabilities. Despite their full time jobs and graduate school attendance, their passion for sugar art finds the two in their sweet shoppe til the wee hours of the morning.

Each handcrafted masterpiece is custom designed and made to order. Cookies are Kosher, Pareve and come in butter and vanilla flavors. Minimum order is 1 dozen.


See you in the kitchen-

Sara & Rivka 
and the team at The Cookie Cutters
name: The Cookie Cutters

about: Divina offers you the ingredients for a good life: olives and antipasti that are authentic and all-natural.  Visit us at www.foodmatch.com for product info, recipes, nutritional info & more!
description:
Divina Olives and Antipasti represent the culinary heritage of the Mediterranean - authentic taste, farm to table traceability and superb quality.  

Classic olive varietals such as the Greek Kalamata (Peloponnese), Italian Castelvetrano (Sicily) and Mt. Athos Green (Halkidiki, Greece) are produced according to centuries-old methods: they are hand sorted and naturally cured to preserve the delicate taste and flavor profile of each olive varietal.

The Divina selection of antipasti reflects a world where people are passionate about life and food.  The antipasto/meze/tapas table highlights seasonal, local specialties that are expertly prepared and preserved.  Dolmas (stuffed grape leaves), the centerpiece of the meze tradition, are tender, flavorful and hand-rolled using early harvest Sultana grape leaves.  Our award-winning Roasted Red & Yellow tomatoes are tender and luscious, delicately marinated in oil and herbs.  Gigandes Beans from Northern Greece are plump and creamy.   Each is a stand out – unique and inspiring.

FoodMatch also produces a full line of Organic Divina products.  Cultivated and cured without pesticides, coloring or additives, Organic Divina is a true expression of why olives, olive oil and the olive tree have been revered for thousands of years.
name: Divina

With this, the restaurant will not only please your palate with culinary breakfast creations refined by our executive chef, but will also captivate your eyes with the murals that have been completely restored for your own viewing pleasure. Currently, our restaurant offers both buffet and à la carte options, giving guests the satisfaction of choosing from various food selections. Join us for breakfast from 6:30 am to 10:45 am during the weekdays, and from 7:00 am to 11:30 am during the weekends / holidays.

about: We have created the healthiest pet treats using organic and gluten free ingredients. We only want your loved ones eating the best quality food!
description: I am an actor based in NYC, but my love for animals stemmed from my childhood in rural Michigan. I have always been around animals and moving to the city years ago I wasn't able to have pets where I lived. My solution was to bring my love and joy to other people's pets! I started a dog walking and sitting company to share my love.  Every single client would ask my advice about what to feed their pets.  I sometimes was at a loss because many pets require special diets and lots of food/treats contain questionable ingredients.  I couldn't find any treats that I  would want feed to my pets so I created some. These are the healthiest pet treats and we only use organic and gluten free ingredients.  We also cater to any allergies your pet may have.  If you love animals as much as I do you only want them eating the good stuff! No mystery ingredients here, only human grade !
name: Pupster Bakery

description:
forty2West is a little bit steakhouse -- it serves Porterhouse for two and Bone-in Ribeye; forty2 West is a little bit Italian -- there are impeccable house-made pastas and crudo; And forty2West is a little bit gastrobar – it boasts an extensive raw bar and craft beer selection. In a nutshell, this bi-level restaurant near Rockefeller Center is an Italian Chophouse and Gastrobar whose kitchen is led by a young, bold alum of Mario Batali’s empire, John Di Lemme.

Owners Lenny Passarelli and Toni Ann Albanese (of New York institution AJ Maxwell’s) and Restaurant Director Bill Resk (of acclaimed restaurant Olana) have kept the atmosphere pleasantly classic and old-school. The wait staff is made up of friendly veterans, while the downstairs dining room has dim lighting, white table cloths and plenty of cozy, round booths. In the front of the restaurant is a full bar and lounge that’s ideal for watching sports, while private party rooms and another full bar are upstairs, where guests have a balcony view of the downstairs portion of the restaurant.

Katie Rosenhouse, the lauded pastry chef who used to work for Bill Resk at Olana and has won the Food Network competition shows “Chopped” and “Sweet Genuius,” designed forty2West’s dessert program. Her creations are crave-worthy yet refined – chocolate, cheesecake and more.
name: Forty2westnyc

about: RAVE is considered the finest glatt kosher caterer, proudly serving the Metro New York area and beyond. Clients truly appreciate our commitment to excellence and fine attention to detail, recognizing that our performance is simply unsurpassed.
description:
RAVE has quickly and quietly become the New York metro area’s preeminent caterer, renowned for spectacular food, flawless service, and exceptional attention to detail. Whether it be an intimate dinner for two, a corporate function hosting thousands, RAVE provides a level of personalized attention and care that is unique in the catering world. At RAVE creative and resourceful events planners work closely with a highly-skilled culinary team to create events that will exceed your expectations . . .  and leave you and your guests raving about your fabulous party!
 
Storybook Weddings...glamorous Cocktail Parties...fairy tale Sweet Sixteens. When everything must be perfect, call on RAVE. With each event, RAVE introduces delicious new food combinations and elegant, innovative presentations to ensure that your party will truly stand out as a once-in-a-lifetime affair. From imaginative themes to incredible flavors, RAVE offers a level of professionalism that is simply unsurpassed!

Come to RAVE with your vision of the perfect party and we’ll turn it into a glorious reality. Each party, dinner, or corporate event is uniquely conceived and created for you with your guests in mind. We specialize in transforming ordinary parties into RAVE events. Glatt kosher, Cholov Yisroel, vegetarian and other dietary restrictions are met without ever sacrificing quality, always offering delicious and elegant choices that ensure that each and every guest feels like the guest of honor. Our chefs are continually exploring, creating and perfecting new menus which reflect the latest trends in dining, yet are consistent with the preferences of our clients and their guests. Tell us what you like and we’ll create a signature dish just for you! Clients tell us how much they enjoy working with our event planners, telling us that not only are they creative, resourceful and incredibly organized, they are kind and caring, too. Like the rest of the team at RAVE, our event planners are perfectionists. They remember— and address— every last detail, always working to ensure that you are a guest at your own party! And what a time you’ll have!

It is no secret that our commitment to excellence and attention to detail have earned RAVE a loyal clientele. From local politicians to distinguished foreign leaders, right on up to the President of the United States, RAVE has served them all with consistently high quality and creative panache. Whether you’re planning an intimate family dinner or a fabulous holiday celebration, you and your guests will enjoy the same level of superlative service, culinary sophistication and imaginative presentation. RAVE has the unique ability to make each guest feel like a VIP. You’ll soon understand why the most discerning hosts choose RAVE, again and again!
name: RAVE Catering & Event Planning

description: In Manhattan in 1965, there was no place where people could go out to meet friends and make new ones in an environment that was at once both relaxed and yet exciting. Then, Alan Stillman opened Fridays as a way, he said, “to meet Pan Am stewardesses.” Suddenly, there was a place with great food, new and exciting drinks and an electric energy. A place where bartenders mixed the environment just as well as they mixed drinks. In short, a place like nowhere else. Today, Fridays in New York, NY is still America’s most iconic bar and grill. We embrace and celebrate our heritage as a bar. One that just happens to serve killer food in an environment where it’s always Friday.
name: TGI Fridays

Four food trucks have permanently parked on Chef Street, including authentic Japanese ramen noodles, crispy chicken wings and sandwiches, traditional Italian street food, and classic American burgers, fries and milkshakes.

about: New York City’s largest indoor/outdoor hotel rooftop bar and lounge features an “urban amusement park” concept with an adult sensibility and epic Empire State Building skyline views.
description: New York City’s largest indoor/outdoor hotel rooftop bar and lounge features an “urban amusement park” concept with an adult sensibility and epic Empire State Building skyline views. Highlights of the 10,000 square foot rooftop include carousel seating, an oversized topiary garden, and Foreplay, a miniature putt-putt, featuring life-size animals in naughty poses. The vast, all-season rooftop comprises multiple bars and seating areas, each with a distinct vibe and design sensibility to provide an endless stream of indelible moments. A menu of shareable light bites is full of modern takes on classic “State Fair” items including Sausage & Peppers, Maine Lobster Roll, Duck Carnitas Tacos, and the Carnival Burger. A unique and cheeky addition to the menu is the option to book one of the hotel’s nineteen Crashpads ($99.00) – meant for those who may have had a few too many rounds on the carousel or simply don’t want the night to end. Nightly live DJs and a list of decadent cocktails—along with beer, wine, Champagne, and spirits—add to the sense of indulgence and amusement. Reservations will be accepted every night of the week and hotel guests will receive priority rooftop access.
name: Magic Hour Rooftop Bar & Lounge

about: Classic cocktails made to perfection in recently restored historic office of John W. Campbell in iconic New York institution, Grand Central Terminal.
description: On Wednesday, May 17th, Gerber Group will open The Campbell, an iconic New York institution located in Grand Central Terminal. Thoughtfully restored to its original grandeur, the restoration maintains the integrity of the property’s historic architecture while introducing contemporary design elements, together creating a refined yet approachable atmosphere. The Campbell will provide three unique property experiences and showcase many of the thirteenth century Florentine-inspired design intricacies that gave John W. Campbell’s private office and reception hall its legendary allure. Gerber Group’s selection of classic and modern cocktails, that highlight fresh ingredients, wines and locally brewed craft beers, will be complemented by a menu of elevated bar fare and lunch specialties, including small plates, soups, salads and sandwiches. Grand Central Terminal, 15 Vanderbilt Avenue (off 43rd Street).
name: The Campbell

about: Hot Dogs and Egg Creams
description:
The history of New York City is inextricably linked to the history of the American hot dog. Coney Island was the first place in America to offer hot dogs as a hand-held snack 140 years ago.  The Polo Grounds and the original Madison Square Garden followed suit by serving hot dogs to their patrons at sporting events.  No picture of New York street life is complete without the classic hot dog cart on every other corner.  No hand-held food is more familiar to the New York customer on the fly, be it as a meal or as a snack to tide us over until the next meal.  And nothing says New York more strongly to the out of town visitor than a classic hot dog.

Frankie’s Dogs on the Go will build on this New York tradition, adding an upscale twist to the comfort and familiarity of the beloved hot dog.  An array of hot and cold toppings, many of them house-made, will be available to garnish the hot dogs.  Assorted mustards, pickle relish, ketchup and hot sauce will be available to finish off the dog in style.

In addition to the traditional beef frank, Frankie’s Dogs on the Go will offer Poultry to Vegetarian to Organic to Beef and Pork to Bratwurst to Beer-Wurst and seasonal favorites like Bangers.

No beverage says New York like the egg cream.  Available in the classic flavors, Frankie’s egg creams will start with ice cold milk and seltzer shot from the old fashioned seltzer siphon.  Stirring briskly with a long handled parfait spoon, the egg cream develops a white, foamy head.  Then Fox’s U-Bet syrup, in chocolate, vanilla, and black & white, is gently poured down the inside of the cup.  Quick, frothy and soothing, made to order and carried away in the cup used to make the egg cream--the perfect partner to the classic Frankie’s dog.
name: Frankies Dogs on the Go

about: Second largest champagne maker in the world, Vranken Pommery is a producer of elegant and refined champagnes, wines, and ports.
description:
Vranken Pommery Monopole was created in 1976 by Paul Francois Vranken. 
Today, the group is the second largest producer of champagne and the largest producer of rose still wines in Europe.
Vranken Pommery America is the US subsidiary. We imports and distribute the portfolio in all 50 states.
The group has 3 core activities in 3 unique terroirs:
- Champagne: with prestigious houses such as Pommery founded in 1836, Heidsieck Monopole founded in 1785, Charles Lafitte created in 1834, and Champagne Vranken, started in 1976
- Wine: with our leading rose brand Listel
- Port wines: with historical Rozes port founded in 1855
name: Champagne Pommery America

about: Classic Style ~ Fresh Ideas ~ Phenomenal Service
description:
Metro Catering & Events is New York’s Preeminent Catering and Event Management Company. 

For over two decades the Metro Catering and Events has been providing culinary excellence in a unique and creative style for catering and events in New York City. 
Whether hosting your event at a Landmark New York Venue, your office or home, or at one of our venue locations, Metro offers sophisticated offerings, professional service and superior event Management.  From Corporate Board Meetings, to Cocktail Parties, Formal Social Events our team will create the custom catering solutions tailored to meet your requirements. Our event teams specialize in creating the perfect, meeting, party or event.

Corporate Catering and Events

From Board Meetings, Training Seminars, Holiday Parties or any corporate function our track record for flawless execution of your event is unsurpassed. Our catering teams will work with you to provide professional service, superior culinary offerings, the latest in table and buffet design, in addition to offering state of the art technology options, and event security to assure you the perfect event.

Social Catering and Events

Metro is one of New York’s most relied on caterers to handle your social catering or event requirements. Our Social planners will work with you to provide you with creative menu’s, flowers and music to make your social event perfect in every way. Our team will handle all the details so that you can enjoy your event and socialize with your guests. No detail will be overlooked 

Venues Locations
Metro is proud to offer two of our own venue locations in NYC to host your event, in addition to many landmark and premier lofts and gallery locations throughout the city.
Imagine an open-air gala under the stars at our Avenue of the Americas location. Just imagine the elegant atmosphere an event in the winter months would have in a heated tent. Our event management team will guide you through the process of selecting china, linen, entertainment, event styling, and create an event that will be a lasting memory.

Our Commitment to You
Metro will make sure that every detail of your meeting, party or event is handled with perfect professional service down to every detail.  Our commitment to a perfect event or party is unsurpassed. Our track record makes Metro New York’s preeminent caterer. Our Event planners will work within your requirements offering a plan to fit every range of your budgetary requirements. Metro, New York’s Preeminent Catering and Event Management Company.
name: Metro Catering & Events

about: Chef Lembe is a brand for nutritional products intended to make cooking more fun and food more tasty. This family owned and operated business was founded by Esther Gadpaille with the objective of passing down recipes to future generations.
description:
Chef Lembe is a brand for nutritional products intended to make cooking more fun and food more tasty. This family owned and operated business was founded by Esther Gadpaille with the objective of passing down recipes to future generations that have been in her family for over a hundred years. Chef Lembe was named after Esther's first granddaughter, Lembe, who took a liking to cooking alongside her grandmother from a young age. 

The Chef Lembe brand came to be when Esther began experimenting in the kitchen to find the perfect ingredients that would help make the preparation of family meals less time consuming while maintaining the authenticity of the dishes. Thus, Stew Helper and other Natural Delites were born. She has distributed these products all over the USA for the past 10 years.

Today, she is working on other innovative products that are healthy, time efficient, and economical​
name: Chef Lembe

about: Fuji Sushi brings fine Japanese cuisine to the Theater District of NYC. Come discover fresh sushi, succulent seafood, & fresh veggies cooked to perfection.
description:
Welcome to Fuji Sushi, conveniently located in the heart of New York City in the Theater District at 360 W. 42nd Street, between 8th and 9th Avenue. Our restaurant menu offers a wide array of fine Japanese sushi. Our simple dream is to be a neighborhood restaurant, to make new friends, create, experiment, live & learn.

Come and discover the personalized experience of having your choice of fresh sushi, succulent seafood, tender chicken, juicy steaks, and garden-fresh vegetables cooked to delicious perfection. We’ve created an extraordinary zen environment that will feed the senses and entertain the appetite. You can also order your favorite Fuji Sushi meals online for take out or delivery.

With a menu so full of flavorful, authentic cuisine, you’re sure to find something to enjoy at Fuji Sushi. Join us today for a delicious meal!
name: Fuji Sushi
